title: Change
text:
How many ways are there to payncents? We assume that the payment must be made with pennies (1 cent),  nickels (5 cents), dimes (10 cents), quarters (25 cents), and  half-dollars (50 cents).For example, there are four ways to pay 13 cents, namely (13 pennies),  (2 nickels, 3 pennies), (1 nickel, 8 pennies), and (1 dime, 3 pennies).InputThe input will contain multiple test cases. Each test case contains a single line with a single integern(1 ≤n≤ 1000000000).The input will be terminated by the end of file.OutputFor each input integern, output how many ways are there to payncents in a single line.Sample Input13
100000000Sample Output4
66666793333412666685000001
